title: Teenage boy shot on Cleveland's East Side
content:
CLEVELAND, Ohio - A teenage boy was shot Sunday afternoon on the city's East Side, police said.
The shooting happened about 2 p.m. near the intersection of East 61st Street and Francis Avenue in the city's Broadway-Slavic Village neighborhood, Cleveland police spokeswoman Sgt. Jennifer Ciaccia said. The victim, a 15-year-old boy, was struck in the leg.
He was taken to MetroHealth by paramedics, Ciaccia said. The teen was transported in serious but stable condition, Cleveland EMS said, but his current condition is unknown.
No further details about the shooting's circumstances have been released. This post will be updated if more information becomes available Sunday afternoon.
